pros: Great company to work for the best
cons: None. Great job they care about is

pros: - Student centered - Peer support - Mostly flexible work/life balance
cons: - Compensation - Human Resources - High Turnover

pros: Great people, great benefits (PERSI retirement & health care), offers a significant tuition waiver for several Idaho-based community colleges, invests in you as a person.
cons: Low hourly wage for lower tier workers. It is a bit demoralizing when you make the same hourly wage as McDonalds workers.

pros: Great leadership on the workforce development side
cons: Annual pay increases are minimal

review_title: Making Inroads into Affordable Quality Post-secondary Education
job_title: Online Adjunct Professor in Nampa, ID
pros:
The team at CWI goes hard into "how do we best serve the needs of our community--specifically our community of students?"

The breadth of opportunities here, the course variety, and the staff, are top-shelf.
cons: Pay in academia is...well...not a primary job. You have to find a side hustle--or make this your side hustle. It's not horrible, but don't plan to retire comfortably if this is your chosen full-time vocation.

pros: New president, hopefully he will change the culture.
cons: Various departments do not work well together.

pros: Structured environment with room for growth
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: Started out great, has gone downhill
pros: Understanding supervisors, flexible schedules, great coworkers, can do homework when it’s not busy
cons: We’re very overworked and very underpaid. They’re having a hard time hiring new people (I’m sure because of the low pay), so they pile more and more responsibilities on us…but of course don’t pay us more.

pros: Great communication with all staff
cons: Pay is low for a lead position

pros: Benefits, interaction with students, networking. It was the perfect job while attending school full time.
cons:
Must have the ability to speak to and execute with 100% accuracy what compares to 1000's of pages of website and/or manuals. Or should I call them "walk throughs". For $13.00/hr

Most common answer to questions from Assistant Directors: "Just reach out". Problem is, nobody answers. Zero interdepartmental support, effort or team orientation. Everyone is out for themselves at the expense of others.

For an organization that markets itself as diverse and inclusive, working there is anything but. Green management is the main cause. And just as anywhere else, HR is there to protect the company, not the employees. Especially the ignorant, uneducated hourly staff. They are not important enough to do a real HR review.

No, the management in this organization spend more time in meetings patting each other on the back than they do assisting students. The sad part is, they totally have all the tools to provide students the best service around. They just need more management that has a clue as to what they are doing.

job_title: Assistant Vice President in Nampa, ID
pros: Amazing leaders at the institution
cons: Every company has their own struggles...

review_title: Love the work, hate the pay.
pros: Working with students is rewarding.
cons: Pay is too way low for the work we do, skills and education required, and responsibilities.

pros: Some flexibility, able to work from home 2 days a week
cons: Hostile work environment perpetuated from the top, down, causing 200% turnover in less than 2 years. Even after CFO and Controller replaced, destructive elements remain, new CFO seems to keep the same negative atmosphere.

job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Nampa, ID
pros: Great people to work with.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Great Place to Work and Live
pros: Great location, high pay for the area, and stable
cons: Limited growth within the department due to size

pros:
- Great benefits 
- Supervisor supports professional development and career goals
- Good work/life balance
cons: - Boise campus buildings are rented, so certain rooms don’t have enough space for what staff might need to better serve the students

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Nampa, ID
pros: Great benefits with health, dental and retirement.
cons: Lacks room for career growth.

pros: Working with refugees very rewarding, great collaboration with co-workers
cons: low pay for high expectations, qualifications. A lot of prep and unpaid time outside of class, No chance for advancement or full time work.

pros: Excellent benefits and culture and diversity
cons: The pay is a bit low

pros: Good school, nice people, and educational
cons: Hard work and a lot of work

pros: Awesome place to help students get a great education
cons: Several campuses that are spreadwout

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Nampa, ID
pros: Great benefits, lot of independence, great industry connections friendly staff
cons: It is a state controlled agency

review_title: Good people - good place to work. Good place to obtain an AA, or Workforce job - or both.
pros: GREAT staff and faculty. The students are the best! Very exciting to work in this college and see the faces of the future going above and beyond. Staff to staff is very helpful at every campus. SW Idaho is so much better off since CWI has started. The entire state of Idaho is better off, actually. Positive remard
cons: CWI's Human Resource personnel: WHAT has been going on with CWI's HR??? Can't hold onto people. Then newbies come in and force some hibbily- dibbily politically correct training. Then they either quit or get fired. HR also needs to be more available to answer questions (how about answering your email, HR?) Training: HR needs training.OR, maybe there is a reason people don't last in HR; how about looking into this, SOMEONE?

pros:
I would suggest working here if you want to get a feel for higher education, but I would advise against committing more than a few years of your life to this organization as it currently exists.

- Everyone loves what they do here (staff and faculty alike).
- PERSI is rare anymore, and it's great that CWI still offers it.
- There is a lot of blending when it comes to roles and responsibilities (this can be a con depending on your perspective).
- The faculty are all experts in their fields of study, and are always open to sharing their knowledge.
cons:
- Communication from senior leadership is often very poor.
- Many workplace processes are undocumented.
- Few people know the extent of their responsibilities, or who to contact if a problem is out of their scope.
- A lot of important decisions get tied up in ineffective committee groups.
- Faculty are almost never asked for input on policies or other decisions which directly impact them.

review_title: Negative Culture--No Leadership and No Integrity
pros: Diverse student age and student appreciation for quality instructors. It is wonderful working with CWI students
cons: The leadership (Board, president, deans, some dept. chairs) do not listen; therefore, they make ill-informed decisions. The culture is so negative; there is zero trust of leadership. Transparency (where it is needed) is missing, and often faculty are disregarded--and at times lied to. Many of us had high hopes for CWI, and it was good in the beginning (first year), but the bully tactics within the administration (some deans) that exist are reflective of President Glandon and his dishonesty and need for control.

pros: CWI has a VERY GOOD atmosphere with the staff and faculty. We really do work together very well. Pay is okay, not the best, but okay. Many of us do know we are here for the students, and the students are most important to us. We also put out quality.
cons: Sure some students have negative comments, but the success stories way out number any negatives. Sometimes it's the student, not the staff/faculty. There is a sense of entitlement with some of the younger students, and that goes for the entire U.S.

review_title: Solid start up school, but things move too slow
pros: The people are usually fantastic to work with.  People are eager to do a good job and help you do the same.  Management is a mixed bag (I've had both great and terrible, luckily currently great) and benefits are fantastic.  Training is solid.  Opportunities for a promotion is very present.
cons: Upper management (Directors, VPs) can be slow and detached.  Things that require action or investigation take way too long.  Not enough willingness to get necessary info to make good judgment calls.  Sometimes upper leadership can leave you feeling like a cog.  Not sufficient HR policies (i.e. time-off request regulations)

pros: I really like working with the people here.  They are friendly and helpful.  I find it very refreshing to interact with the students.  They are just starting out, while I've been working  41 years.  I really enjoy talking with the students.  Also, we get the entire summer off.
cons: As a first-year teacher, I had to develop a new curriculum based on a new programming framework.  There was no reference material available.  This was an incredible amount of work.  Also, the pay isn't that great.

pros: Staff is very friendly and supportive. Great quality of life in this area. Feels great to help students achieve their goals and watch them grow.
cons: Out-sourced IT staff is only major negative. They don't seem to have the college's best interests in mind. All the best people quit when IT got out-sourced. What's left is not good, and the company seems to not be in a hurry to find good folks, since that means more money in their pocket.

job_title: IT Systems Engineer in Nampa, ID
pros: Great health benefits and retirement
cons: Hope you like meetings. More time was spent in agile meetings than actually doing any work. It is also very clicky. If your not part of the “in” crowd you will either be told to conform or your boss will give work to other people. People talk behind your back but put on a fake smile to your face. The IT management is terrible at communicating with you unless you have done something wrong. You can never find management if you need something and they won’t respond to emails.

pros: Decent compensation. Convient work hours. Some really great departments. Convenient locations. Paid twice a month.
cons: Constantly changing. The departments are constantly being reorganized so you never know who you report to when there is a problem. Know one ever has any answers when you need them. Poor communication.

job_title: Lab Assistant Coordinator & Tutor in Nampa, ID
pros:
Can be great for student workers
Time to work on homework when slow
Help other students 
Learn to work as a team and Individual
cons: Pay needs to be raised

review_title: i enjoyed my adjunct and pt adult educator positions at CWI
pros: Flexible schedule; kind and positive staff
cons: very part time; a lot of grading

pros: Students are nice. When you can avoid admin and focus on students you forget how bad things are at CWI. There are some great students.
cons: This college is a quite bad to work for. No focus on students. It is all about pleasing administrators. Do it or your classes get cut, programs gets cut, and you get cut.

pros: great students and flexible schedule
cons: constant turn over, lack of College support, and policies are not always followed- unfair

pros: Great Culture and people are passionate about what they do
cons: Salary is a little low compared to the private for profit sector

pros: Teachers really care about each other and students
cons: the business office that handles a lot of funding and pay can be a mess

review_title: Great people, not so great system

review_title: Great nursing school.  Top NCLEX scores!

pros: Small and friendly with great student nurses

job_title: Desktop Support Technician in Nampa, ID
pros: Excellent guidance and direction for support.
cons: Provide additional hands on training

pros: Flexible, great coworkers, great supervisor.
cons: Nothing to complain about. Very good place to work.
